intro: Minuartia woronowii, commonly known as the rock sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to rocky and alpine environments. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant has thin, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its harsh, arid habitats. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found on rock faces or in crevices. Minuartia woronowii is adapted to cold climates and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value in rock gardens.
